meta.good: items being reused in a way that improves on the original
meta.ok: images that show something in the process of being rebuilt or reused

teaching.tips: As far as we can tell, this is just a regular table, so it is not 'upcycled' and therefore not relevant.

This is very relevant to people searching for 'upcycle', because they are repurposing old toys as hangers. Sometimes, you can get tips by hovering over the image. This isn't always useful, but in this case, it points out that those animals are 'toys'.
Remember to read the instructions, which explain that relevant 'upcycle' images show things that improve on the original. Here, plastic bottles are used for decoration, make something out of junk.
This one is tricky, but since it looks like a craft that salvaged extra material, it would be interesting to somebody searching for 'upcycle'.
This clothing took a Dr. Suiss t-shirt and re-used it for a dress.
This doesn't show materials in the process of being upcycled, and it seems to just be a card that doesn't reuse things.
This one is tricky, because the image alone doesn't make it clear that it reuses the colorful cards used for paint samples. When in doubt, see if the descriptions gives more details.
Plastic bottles for cups: a case of reusing materials that makes them more valuable.

This is another tough one, because it is hard to tell if these boxes were bought like that or reuse burlap. Since it might still interest of give a searcher ideas for 'upcycle', it is somewhat relevant: useful, but 'very relevant' images are better search results.
